item.title: Stock Buyback and Interest Rate
item.description: Nowadays we have seen lots of news about companies buying back their stocks. For example, here is a stock buyback chart for Apple Inc in the past few years: (source: YChart) Usually after the stock buyback plan is announced, the company’s stock goes up. Why does a company buy back its stock? Why does the buyback push up the stock price? Why do we see the stock buyback happen more frequently in the past decade?
